revised_title: Infra-Red Absorption Spectrum of Methylamine Vapour
tldr: The authors studied the infra-red absorption spectrum of methylamine vapour and found that the band envelopes are largely those of an approximately symmetrical rotator with almost completely inhibited internal rotation. They assigned observed bands by working partly by analogy with the known spectra of mono-derivatives of methane and considering translations and rotations of the CH3 and NH2 groups relative to one another.
